intro: Ichnanthus velutinus, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its hairy, velvety leaves that give it its common name. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are typically clustered in spikes. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks. Ichnanthus velutinus is valued for its ornamental appeal and has also been used in traditional medicine.
